general_advisory: As per Extended Range Forecast of IMD, rainfall is above normal and both maximum and minimum temperature is expected to be normal for Odisha state during 3rd July to 9th July, 2024. Farmers are advised to take necessary action towards kharif crop cultivation and avoid irrigation during that period. In view of thunderstorm accompanied with gusty winds, farmers should provide mechanical support to orchards, staking in vegetables, and avoid grazing of animals during lightning. Farmers should start nursery bed preparation for kharif paddy and vegetable crops and also start planting new fruit crops in orchard by taking advantage of past rainfall conditions. Prevailing weather condition is favorable for mealy bug attack in all types of crops so farmers should spray Thiamethoxam 25% WG @ 0.5-0.6g or Imidacloprid 17.8 % SL @ 0.5ml or Lambda Cyhalothrin 4.9 % CS per liter of water to control these insects but farmers should wait some days for any spraying operation because there is a chance of occurrence of rainfall in the upcoming days.

advisory: Looking to the past rainfall condition and chance of heavy rainfall in one or two places in upcoming days, farmers are advised to prepare field for nursery sowing of Paddy.
Before sowing, seed treatment should be done with Carbendazim 50% WP @ 2g/kg of seeds or Trichoderma @ 10 g/kg of seeds.
Farmers who have not yet started field preparation for cultivation of cotton crop are advised to start the preparation as soon as possible.
Seed should be treated with imidachloprid 70 WG @ 7 g/kg of seed for protection against sucking pests.
Spacing should be 90 × 45-60 cm and 90-120 × 90 cm for normal and hybrid variety respectively.
Fertilizer Application: For Hybrid varieties 48 kg Nitrogen, 24 kg each Phosphorus and Potash whereas 32 kg Nitrogen, 16 kg each Phosphorus and Potash for normal varieties should be recommended.
Past weather conditions are favorable for sucking insect pest attack in vegetable crops so regular monitoring should be advised.
If attack of those insects is noticed, then spraying of Thiamethoxam 25% WG @ 0.5-0.6g or Imidacloprid 17.8% SL @ 0.5ml per liter of water should be advised.

As there is a chance of rainfall expected in upcoming days, farmers are advised to take proper care while conducting spraying operations and also start nursery bed preparation and sowing of kharif vegetable crops with proper protection.
Heavy rainfall may occur in one or two places over the district, so strengthening of drainage facilities should be advised to avoid waterlogged in vegetable field.
Deworming and vaccination of animal against FMD, HS and BQ should be ensured at the beginning of commencement of monsoon (rainy season).
Soft and tender grass is more palatable to cattle, but magnesium deficiency is seen in dairy cows when eating too much litter, so a variety of grasses should be fed instead of just soft grass.
During rainy season, make provision to ensure proper ventilation by allowing an opening of 1-2 ft at the top of side curtains during the day.
Empty shed walls should be completely covered with polythene curtains to avoid fly and insect pest attack.
Deworming and vaccination of poultry birds against ranikhet disease must be ensured.
In roofs, the side overhangs should be minimum 3 to 4 ft to prevent entry of direct rainwater into the shed.
